Articles.Content: Oh you know, like Reddit and some other forums... Can we get notifications when someone quotes us?
I'm a member of one forum running on XenForo and find that feature extremely useful, especially when I don't visit for a while.
I just have it set to subscribe me to every thread I post in.

I'm told that our current forum software does not support this, but the new one we're intending to get might.

Meanwhile, moved to Kerbal Network.

I'm told that our current forum software does not support this, but the new one we're intending to get might.

Meanwhile, moved to Kerbal Network.

Then I'm afraid you've been informed dead wrong. https://www.vbulletin.org/forum/showthread.php?t=242358

vBulletin is capable of handling an inconceivable array of options and plug-ins. It's all about the willingness to actually implement them.

Then I'm afraid you've been informed dead wrong. https://www.vbulletin.org/forum/showthread.php?t=242358

vBulletin is capable of handling an inconceivable array of options and plug-ins. It's all about the willingness to actually implement them.

However, that plugin supports VB 4.0.x. This forum is using 4.2.1.

Furthermore, with the upgrade to IPS coming SoonÃ¢â€žÂ¢, it's probably not a good idea to go implementing and tweaking new features. Might result in some corrupted data somewhere

However, that plugin supports VB 4.0.x. This forum is using 4.2.1.

Furthermore, with the upgrade to IPS coming SoonÃ¢â€žÂ¢, it's probably not a good idea to go implementing and tweaking new features. Might result in some corrupted data somewhere

So what that it's for and old vBulletin version? The fact that it's already a five year old plug-in only strengthens my point. I won't say you should use that plug-in but if it was possible five years ago it sure as hell is possible now.
I actually find that feature annoying... WAY too many notifications...
That's what settings are for. You can easily disable those notifications.
